questions.correct_answer: The pilot-in-command.

questions.question_text: Which of the following must be considered when computing fuel and oil requirements for a flight?
options: Only the direct route to the destination.
Only the aircraft's maximum endurance.
Expected ATC routings and anticipated traffic delays.
Only the payload and passenger count.
questions.correct_answer: Expected ATC routings and anticipated traffic delays.

questions.question_text: When refueling with passengers on board, what is a key requirement regarding communication?
options: Passengers must be informed via the cabin PA system.
Two-way communication must be maintained between ground crew and qualified personnel on board.
Only hand signals are permitted to avoid radio interference.
Communication is only required if an emergency arises.
questions.correct_answer: Two-way communication must be maintained between ground crew and qualified personnel on board.

questions.question_text: What is a requirement for cabin baggage stowage before taxi or pushback?
options: It must be placed on empty seats to optimize space.
It must be adequately and securely stowed, and at least one required crew member must verify it.
It must be checked-in if it exceeds a certain size.
It can be held by passengers if space is limited.
questions.correct_answer: It must be adequately and securely stowed, and at least one required crew member must verify it.

questions.question_text: For single-engine landplanes flying over water beyond gliding distance from the shore, what is recommended concerning life jackets?
options: Life jackets are optional if the flight is during daylight hours.
A life raft for all occupants must be carried.
One life jacket or equivalent individual floatation device for each person on board, stowed in an easily accessible position.
Only the pilot needs to wear a life jacket.
questions.correct_answer: One life jacket or equivalent individual floatation device for each person on board, stowed in an easily accessible position.

questions.question_text: What characteristic makes an Emergency Locator Transmitter (ELT) activate automatically upon impact?
options: It is water-sensitive.
It is temperature-sensitive.
It is G-sensitive.
It is light-sensitive.
questions.correct_answer: It is G-sensitive.

questions.question_text: Which of the following frequencies are ELTs capable of transmitting distress signals on, as noted?
options: 121.5 MHz, 243 MHz, or 406 MHz
8.33 kHz, 25 kHz
questions.correct_answer: 121.5 MHz, 243 MHz, or 406 MHz

questions.question_text: What is the primary reason for a Search and Rescue (SAR) operation to stop?
options: When the weather conditions become unfavorable for rescue.
When a set time limit for the search has expired.
After exhausting all possible resources and the probability of survival is negligible.
When the responsible government agency runs out of funding.
questions.correct_answer: After exhausting all possible resources and the probability of survival is negligible.

questions.question_text: What is the definition of a 'Rescue Coordination Center' (RCC)?
options: A facility for storing search and rescue equipment.
A primary search and rescue facility staffed by supervisory personnel and equipped for coordinating and controlling SAR operations.
A training center for search and rescue teams.
A communication relay station for distress calls.
questions.correct_answer: A primary search and rescue facility staffed by supervisory personnel and equipped for coordinating and controlling SAR operations.

questions.question_text: Which phase of emergency is characterized by 'uncertainty exists as to the safety of an aircraft and its occupants'?
options: Alert phase (ALERFA)
Distress phase (DETRESFA)
Uncertainty phase (INCERFA)
Pre-alert phase
questions.correct_answer: Uncertainty phase (INCERFA)

questions.question_text: Which phase of emergency is characterized by 'apprehension exists as to the safety of an aircraft and its occupants'?
options: Distress phase (DETRESFA)
Alert phase (ALERFA)
Uncertainty phase (INCERFA)
Emergency phase
questions.correct_answer: Alert phase (ALERFA)

questions.question_text: Which phase of emergency is characterized by 'reasonable certainty that an aircraft and its occupants are threatened by grave and imminent danger and require immediate assistance'?
options: Alert phase (ALERFA)
Uncertainty phase (INCERFA)
Distress phase (DETRESFA)
Urgency phase
questions.correct_answer: Distress phase (DETRESFA)

questions.question_text: If an aircraft experiences an engine failure in flight, which emergency phase is it considered to be in?
options: Uncertainty phase (INCERFA)
Alert phase (ALERFA)
Distress phase (DETRESFA)
Pre-alert phase
questions.correct_answer: Distress phase (DETRESFA)

questions.question_text: What is the primary purpose of COSPAS-SARSAT?
options: To provide weather satellite imagery for aviation.
To manage global air traffic control communications.
A satellite-aided search and rescue initiative that detects emergency radio beacons.
To track commercial flights for airline operational control.
questions.correct_answer: A satellite-aided search and rescue initiative that detects emergency radio beacons.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT one of the satellite systems utilized by COSPAS-SARSAT, as mentioned in the notes?
options: GPS (USA)
GLONASS (Russia)
BEIDOU (China)
NAVSTAR (Canada)
questions.correct_answer: NAVSTAR (Canada)

questions.question_text: What is the definition of an 'Accident' in aviation?
options: Any unexpected event that does not result in serious losses or injury.

An occurrence associated with the operation of an aircraft in which a person is fatally or seriously injured, the aircraft sustains damage or structural failure, or the aircraft is missing or completely inaccessible.
An event that causes significant flight delays but no physical damage.
A minor malfunction that is corrected in flight without incident.
questions.correct_answer: An occurrence associated with the operation of an aircraft in which a person is fatally or seriously injured, the aircraft sustains damage or structural failure, or the aircraft is missing or completely inaccessible.

questions.question_text: What is the definition of an 'Incident' in aviation?
options: An occurrence that always results in fatalities or serious injuries.
An event where the aircraft is destroyed or completely inaccessible.
Any unexpected event that does not result in serious losses or injury, distinct from an accident which causes damage, injury, or harm.
A pre-planned emergency drill or exercise.
questions.correct_answer: Any unexpected event that does not result in serious losses or injury, distinct from an accident which causes damage, injury, or harm.

questions.question_text: In an aircraft accident investigation, to whom shall the State of Occurrence release custody of the aircraft or its parts when they are no longer required for the investigation?
options: To the media for public viewing.
To any person or persons duly designated by the State of Registry or the State of the Operator.
To the nearest salvage company for disposal.
To the insurance company for assessment.
questions.correct_answer: To any person or persons duly designated by the State of Registry or the State of the Operator.

questions.question_text: What is the requirement for forwarding a notification of an accident or serious incident by the State of Occurrence?
options: Within 24 hours via postal mail.
With a minimum of delay and by the most suitable and quickest means.
Only after all preliminary findings have been established.
Once translated into all working languages of ICAO.
questions.correct_answer: With a minimum of delay and by the most suitable and quickest means.

questions.question_text: What is the required format and content for an accident notification?
options: It must be in a highly technical format, including full flight data.
It shall be in plain language and contain as much readily available information, but its dispatch shall not be delayed due to lack of complete information.
It must contain only unconfirmed preliminary information to avoid speculation.
It must be a voice recording in the native language of the reporting state.
questions.correct_answer: It shall be in plain language and contain as much readily available information, but its dispatch shall not be delayed due to lack of complete information.

questions.question_text: What are the three immediate actions to be taken at an aircraft accident site, as per the notes?
options: Interview witnesses, photograph wreckage, and secure the area.
Remove injured persons/animals, protect the wreckage from further damage, and protect the public from injuries.
Contact next of kin, issue a public statement, and begin preliminary investigation.
Collect flight data recorder, secure personal belongings, and clear debris.
questions.correct_answer: Remove injured persons/animals, protect the wreckage from further damage, and protect the public from injuries.

questions.question_text: What is the minimum passing grade for each subject of theoretical or practical examination/test for an airman license in the Philippines?
Within how many days must a holder of an airman license notify the administrator of a change in their permanent mailing address?
options: 7 days
15 days
30 days
60 days
questions.correct_answer: 30 days

questions.question_text: What is a fundamental requirement for a person to act as a flight crew member of an aircraft?
options: They must be at least 21 years old.
They must hold a valid license appropriate to their duties.
They must have at least 1,000 hours of flight experience.
They must be employed by a certified airline.
questions.correct_answer: They must hold a valid license appropriate to their duties.

questions.question_text: Concerning flight authorizations, what is the relationship between an authorization's validity and the underlying license's validity?
options: An authorization's validity can extend indefinitely beyond the license's expiration if the holder remains proficient.
The validity of the authorization shall not extend beyond the period of validity of the license.
The authorization validity is independent of the license validity.
Authorizations are permanent once issued, regardless of license status.
questions.correct_answer: The validity of the authorization shall not extend beyond the period of validity of the license.

questions.question_text: What restriction applies to the exercise of privileges by a license holder?
options: A holder may exercise privileges of any license, provided they demonstrate proficiency.
A holder may only exercise privileges within the country where the license was issued.
A holder of a license shall not exercise privileges other than the privileges of the license he holds.
Privileges are automatically expanded with additional flight experience.
questions.correct_answer: A holder of a license shall not exercise privileges other than the privileges of the license he holds.

questions.question_text: When may a license or rating be renewed, according to regulations?
options: Within 60 days after its expiration.
Only on the exact date of its expiration.
Any time before its expiration date.
30 days before the expiration.
questions.correct_answer: 30 days before the expiration.

questions.question_text: What is required for the reinstatement of an expired aviation license or rating?
options: Only a written application and payment of a fee.
Completion of a flight review with an instructor.
Passing a CAR and practical examination.
Accumulating a specified number of flight hours.
questions.correct_answer: Passing a CAR and practical examination.

questions.question_text: Under what circumstances is a license holder required to surrender their aviation license?
options: Upon changing their permanent mailing address.
Upon voluntary retirement from aviation.
Upon the suspension, revocation or expiration of the license.
Upon completing a new rating.
questions.correct_answer: Upon the suspension, revocation or expiration of the license.

questions.question_text: Where must an airman's license be kept when they are on duty or performing duties pertinent to their license?
options: It can be kept at home for safekeeping.
It must be kept in the aircraft's logbook compartment.
It should be kept in the pilot's locker at the airport.
A holder of an airman shall keep his license in his person.
questions.correct_answer: A holder of an airman shall keep his license in his person.

questions.question_text: If an airman's license is surrendered on or before its expiration date, what is the consequence regarding future theoretical examinations for reinstatement?
options: They will be required to take both theoretical and practical examinations.
They may not be required to take any theoretical examination.
They must re-take all theoretical examinations but are exempt from practical exams.
Reinstatement is automatically granted without examination.
questions.correct_answer: They may not be required to take any theoretical examination.
